documentation.short: Interface that notifies components when TinyOS has booted (initialized all of its components), as discussed in TEP 107.
Signaled when the system has booted successfully.

documentation.long: The peripheral interrupt event.
Disables a peripheral interrupt.
Enables a periperhal interrupt.
Periodic Interval Timer Interface. @author Rasmus Pedersen
Fired. The event handler must call getPITSR() in this interface. It will clear the status register.

documentation.short: Same as fired, but signalled from a task (posted by the fired event().
documentation.long: Same as fired, but signalled from a task (posted by the fired event(). If this event is used then it is not necessary to post a task in the signalled component to get sync code. @param taskMiss how many times fired failed to post the task that signals firedTask(). Would mean that "something" is taking longer than 1 ms somewhere in the system without giving up control.

documentation.short: Post this task to the TinyOS scheduler.
documentation.long:
Post this task to the TinyOS scheduler. At some later time, depending on the scheduling policy, the scheduler will signal the <tt>run()</tt> event.
@return SUCCESS if task was successfuly posted; the semantics of a non-SUCCESS return value depend on the implementation of this interface (the class of task).

documentation.short: Event from the scheduler to run this task.
documentation.long: Event from the scheduler to run this task. Following the TinyOS concurrency model, the codes invoked from <tt>run()</tt> signals execute atomically with respect to one another, but can be preempted by async commands/events.

documentation.short: The interface to a TinyOS task scheduler.

documentation.long: Enter an infinite task-running loop. Put the MCU into a low power state when the processor is idle (task queue empty, waiting for interrupts). This call never returns.

documentation.short: Run the next task if one is waiting, otherwise return immediately.
Interface to instruct the MCU to enter a low power state.
Called by the scheduler to put the MCU to sleep.
documentation.long: Called by the scheduler to put the MCU to sleep. *

documentation.short: Interface to instruct TinyOS that the low-power state of the MCU may have changed.
Called by any component to tell TinyOS that the MCU low power state may have changed.
documentation.long: Called by any component to tell TinyOS that the MCU low power state may have changed. Generally, this should be called whenever a peripheral/timer is started/stopped.
@author Phil Buonadonna @author Philip Levis

documentation.short: Notification that the write operation has completed
Notification that the read operation has completed

documentation.long: UC1601 Display Interface @author Rasmus Ulslev Pedersen

documentation.short: Display a string on a line in the display.

documentation.long: Adapted for nxtmote. @author Rasmus Pedersen

Set TWI master mode register.
@param val : AT91C_TWI_DADR - Device address AT91C_TWI_MREAD - Master read direction AT91C_TWI_IADRSZ - Internal Device Address (0 means no internal device addr.)

Set TWI interrupt disable register.
@param val : AT91C_TWI_TXCOMP - Transmission completed AT91C_TWI_RXRDY - Receive holding register ready AT91C_TWI_TXRDY - Transmit holding register ready AT91C_TWI_NACK - Not acknowledge

Set TWI interrupt enable register.
@param val : AT91C_TWI_TXCOMP - Transmission completed AT91C_TWI_RXRDY - Receive holding register ready AT91C_TWI_TXRDY - Transmit holding register ready AT91C_TWI_NACK - Not acknowledge

Set TWI control register.
@param val : AT91C_TWI_START - Send a start condition AT91C_TWI_STOP - Send a stop condition AT91C_TWI_MSEN - Master transfer enabled AT91C_TWI_MSDIS - Master Transfer disabled AT91C_TWI_SWRST - Software reset

Set TWI status register.
@param val : AT91C_TWI_TXCOMP - Transmission completed AT91C_TWI_RXRDY - Receive holding register ready AT91C_TWI_TXDRY - Transmit holding register ready AT91C_TWI_NACK - Not acknowledged AT91C_TWI_OVRE - Overrun Error AT91C_TWI_UNRE - Underrun Error

Get TWI receive holding register.
@return val The received byte.

documentation.short: Set TWI clock waveform generator register.
documentation.long:
Set TWI clock waveform generator register.
@param val : AT91C_TWI_CLDIV - Clock low divider AT91C_TWI_CHDIV - Clock high divider AT91C_TWI_CKDIV - Clock divider
Notification for an i2c event.

Set TWI transmit holding register.
@param val The byte to transmit in bit 7:0.

documentation.long: Send init string to LCD. Not the same as Init.init() that is used for SPI initialization.

@return FAIL if error, SUCCESS otherwise
